mfm.fluorescence.tcspc package¶

Submodules¶

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.convolve module¶

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.convolve.convolve_lifetime_spectrum(decay: 'np.array', lifetime_spectrum: 'np.array', irf: 'np.array', stop: 'int' = -1, time_axis: 'np.array' = None) → 'None'[source]¶

Fills the pre-allocated array with a fluorescence intensity decay convolved (non-periodically) with an instrumental response function.

This function calculates a fluorescence intensity decay that is convolved with an instrumnet response function (IRF). The fluorescence intensity decay is specified by its fluorescence lifetime spectrum, i.e., an interleaved array containing fluorescence lifetimes with corresponding amplitudes.

Parameters

  • decay (<built-in function array>) – numpy-array This array filled with the values of the computed fluorescence intensity decay

  • lifetime_spectrum (<built-in function array>) – interleaved vector of amplitudes and fluorescence lifetimes

  • irf (<built-in function array>) – the instrument response function

  • stop (int) – convolution stop channel (the index on the time-axis)

  • time_axis (Optional[<built-in function array>]) – the time-axis of the decay

Return type

None

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.convolve.convolve_lifetime_spectrum_periodic(decay: 'np.array', lifetime_spectrum: 'np.array', irf: 'np.array', start: 'int', stop: 'int', n_points: 'int', period: 'float', dt: 'float', conv_stop: 'int')[source]¶
Parameters

  • decay (<built-in function array>) – array of doubles Here the convolved fit is stored

  • lifetime_spectrum (<built-in function array>) – array of doubles Lifetime-spectrum of the form (amplitude, lifetime, amplitude, lifetime, …)

  • irf (<built-in function array>) – array-doubles The instrument response function

  • start (int) – int Start channel of convolution (position in array of IRF)

  • stop (int) – int Stop channel of convolution (position in array of IRF)

  • n_points (int) – int Number of points in fit and lamp

  • period (float) – double Period of repetition in nano-seconds

  • dt (float) – double Channel-width in nano-seconds

  • conv_stop (int) – int Stopping channel of convolution

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.get_scale_bg(fit: 'np.array', data: 'np.array', data_weight: 'np.array', bg: 'float', start: 'int', stop: 'int') → 'float'[source]¶

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.pddem(decayA, decayB, k, px, pm, pAB)[source]¶

Electronic Energy Transfer within Asymmetric Pairs of Fluorophores: Partial Donor-Donor Energy Migration (PDDEM) Stanislav Kalinin http://www.diva-portal.org/smash/get/diva2:143149/FULLTEXT01

Kalinin, S.V., Molotkovsky, J.G., and Johansson, L.B. Partial Donor-Donor Energy Migration (PDDEM) as a Fluorescence Spectroscopic Tool for Measuring Distances in Biomacromolecules. Spectrochim. Acta A, 58 (2002) 1087-1097.

-> same results as Stas pddem code (pddem_t.c)

Parameters

  • decayA – decay A in form of [ampl lifetime, apml, lifetime…]

  • decayB – decay B in form of [ampl lifetime, apml, lifetime…]

  • k – rates of energy transfer [kAB, kBA]

  • px – probabilities of excitation (pxA, pxB)

  • pm – probabilities of emission (pmA, pmB)

  • pAB – pure AB [0., 0]

Returns

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.rescale_w_bg(fit: 'np.array', decay: 'np.array', w_res: 'np.array', bg: 'float', start: 'int', stop: 'int') → 'float'[source]¶
Return type

float

Module contents¶

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.fitrange(y, threshold: 'float' = 10.0, area: 'float' = 0.999) → 'Tuple[float, float]'[source]¶

Determines the fitting range based on the total number of photons to be fitted (fitting area).

Parameters

  • y – numpy-array a numpy array containing the photon counts

  • threshold (float) – float a threshold value. Lowest index of the fitting range is the first encountered bin with a photon count higher than the threshold.

  • area (float) – float The area which should be considered for fitting. Here 1.0 corresponds to all measured photons. 0.9 to 90% of the total measured photons.

Return type

Tuple[float, float]

Returns

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.weights(y: 'np.array') → 'np.array'[source]¶

Calculated the weights used in TCSPC. Poissonian noise (sqrt of counts) :type y: <built-in function array> :param y: numpy-array

the photon counts

Return type

<built-in function array>

Returns

numpy-array an weighting array for fittin

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.weights_ps(p: 'np.array', s: 'np.array', fs: 'float') → 'np.array'[source]¶

Calculated the weights used in TCSPC. weight = 1/err(P+fs*S)

Parameters

  • p (<built-in function array>) – parallel decay

  • s (<built-in function array>) – perpendicular decay

  • fs (float) – weight of perpendicular decay

Return type

<built-in function array>

Returns

err(p + fs * fs)
